metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20236 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the ZeroMQ server in versions before 4.3.3. This flaw allows a malicious client to cause a stack buffer overflow on the server by sending crafted topic subscription requests and then unsubscribing. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

notes.Note: sespiros> large/too intrusive backport required for all affected releases

criterions.comment: zeromq3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
